feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 7:41AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BANDS OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SHOWERS LIKELY OVER ANCHORAGE TODAY... Bands of moderate to heavy snow showers are likely over Anchorage this morning and then again this evening. Snowfall rates in heavier snow showers could reach one to two inches per hour at times, leading to significantly reduced visibilities. Additional

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 7:41AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BANDS OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS LIKELY ACROSS EASTERN KENAI PENINSULA AND EASTERN TURNAGAIN ARM THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... Bands of moderate to heavy snow showers are likely across the Seward Highway Corridor from Girdwood and Whittier south to Seward Wednesday morning through Thursday morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: East Turnagain Arm; Western Prince William Sound

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 5:37AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Up To Two Additional Inches of Snow Through Wednesday Afternoon... Up to two additional inches of snow are likely through Wednesday afternoon. The heaviest amounts will be from Nenana to Manley Hot Springs. Areas of blowing snow are also likely along the Parks Highway from the Denali Park entrance south to Cantwell.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; Northern Denali Borough; Southern Denali Borough

entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued December 13 at 5:30AM AKST until December 13 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. Visibility one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Shishmaref and Bering Strait Coast.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued December 13 at 4:27AM AKST until December 15 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LONG DURATION HEAVY SNOW EVENT FOR THE HAINES AND KLONDIKE HIGHWAYS WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT... .A wave of moisture moving through the northern panhandle will bring moderate to heavy snow for the Haines and Klondike Highways. A period of snow is likely near sea level for Haines and Skagway beginning late Wednesday night and lasting through Thursday
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 12 at 11:42PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLOWING SNOW ALONG THE ALASKA PENINSULA THROUGH WEDNESDAY... From Pilot Point southwest to Port Heiden, northerly winds gusting to 45 mph combined with persistent snow showers will reduce visibility to one quarter mile at times. Snow showers and gusty winds will continue through tonight, diminishing in intensity with visibility improvements expected by late Wednesday

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued December 13 at 10:42AM MST until December 15 at 2:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches except between 12 and 24 inches above 8500 feet. Locally higher amounts up to 30 inches are possible on high peaks and ridges in the southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. A light glaze of ice is possible in lower elevations this morning and evening.
